section.name: Cell
section.definition: Specification of the recorded cell. definition be a subsection of the Subsect section.

property.name: Type
property.nameDefinition: The type of the recorded cell. E.g. pyramidal cell.

property.name: BrainRegion
property.nameDefinition: The region the cell is located in. For example Retina, Cortex, Cerebellum etc.

property.name: BrainSubRegion
property.nameDefinition: More detailed specification of the region the cell is located in. For example, if BrainRegion is "hippocampus", then the BrainSubRegion may be "CA1".

property.name: Layer
property.nameDefinition: The name of the layer. For example, layer 4 in CA1.

property.name: Ganglion
property.nameDefinition: Like the pro-, meta- and mesothoracal ganglion in invertebrates.

property.name: Structure
property.nameDefinition: The structure of the organism the cell is located in e.g. Eye, Spinal cord...

property.name: RecordingLocation
property.nameDefinition: The recording location in the cell. E.g. axonal, dendritic, somatic, ...

property.name: RestingPotential
property.nameDefinition: What is the cells resting potential of the cell. An indiator for the recording quality.

property.name: BaselineRate
property.nameDefinition: For spiking cells, the spontaneous activity which might be an indicator for the cell's health status and thus recording quality.

property.name: BaselineNoise
property.nameDefinition: The standard deviation of the baseline membrane potential.

property.name: Rheobase
property.nameDefinition: The minimum current required to make the cell fire action potentials.

property.name: InputResistance
property.nameDefinition: The input resistance of the recorded cell.
